resources.string: To the SwEng Android security CTF!

This beginner-friendly CTF game was designed by the SwEng staff to teach you about common Android security vulnerabilities. In this exercise, you will hack this application itself through a series of challenges, each illustrating a realistic attack vector in mobile security.
What the flag is a CTF?

A CTF (or Capture The Flag) is an information security competitive game in which flags (generally string tokens) are hidden into computer systems. Players must steal these flags by solving a variety of challenges, ranging from computer science riddles to exploitation of vulnerable programs or systems in multiple domains (e.g. crypto, web, reverse engineering, hardware, …). This app is a jeopardy-style CTF, in which tasks have been designed in advance and which you will try to crack in order to submit your flags.
A wild notification appeared! That\'s it.
Only for developers; surely no-one will ever use this
Write your flag here, format is flag{secret_flag_value}
Permanently removes all app data persisted on device, including solved challenges and scores (there is no flag to be found by doing this).
Do you really want to delete all stored cache and data from this app?\n\nThis action cannot be undone and IS NOT a necessary step towards finding any flag.
